source.d252373c:
The 2020 Summer Paralympics (Japanese: 東京2020パラリンピック競技大会, Hepburn: Tōkyō Nizeronizero Pararinpikku Kyōgi Taikai), branded as Tokyo 2020 Paralympic Games, were a major international multi-sport parasports event governed by the International Paralympic Committee. It was the 16th Summer Paralympic Games and was held in Tokyo, Japan between 24 August and 5 September 2021.

![para](https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/b/b5/2020_Summer_Paralympics_logo_new.svg/225px-2020_Summer_Paralympics_logo_new.svg.png)

The event was formerly planned to take place on 25 August to 6 September 2020, but postponed to 2021 along with the 2020 Summer Olympics in March 2020 due to the COVID-19 pandemic. Like in the Olympics, the state of emergency happening in Tokyo and the event was held entirely behind closed doors with no physical audience permitted. For marketing purposes, the event was branded as Tokyo 2020 despite taking place in 2021. This was the second Summer Paralympics hosted by Tokyo since the 1964 Games, and the third time the Paralympics were ever held so far in Japan since the 1998 Winter Paralympics. Tokyo was the first city to host the Paralympics more than once.

![para](https://www.el-shai.com/wp-content/uploads/2021/08/hamato2.jpg)

The Paralympics replaced sailing and 7-a-side football with badminton and taekwondo.

China topped the medal table for the fifth consecutive games, with 96 golds and 207 total medals. Great Britain finished second for the ninth time, with 41 golds and 124 total medals. The United States finished third, with 37 golds, their best finish since the 2008 games, and 104 total medals. The Russian Paralympic Committee finished fourth, with a total of 36 golds and 118 total medals, putting them in third place when ranked by total medals.

![](https://phototass1.cdnvideo.ru/width/1020_b9261fa1/tass/m2/en/uploads/i/20210827/1330625.jpg)
